crud

Class StatsFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • crud.StatsFileSystem

  • public class StatsFileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    StatsFileSystem contains methods to interact with the CSV file which contains the stats info.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ze

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewUserToArray(java.lang.String username)
      Add a new user to the stats array, with the corresponding 0s since this player has not played any game yet.
      static StatsFileSystem getInstance()
      The getter for singleton design, it makes sure that there is only one instance of this object.
      java.lang.String[][] getStatsArray()
      Return the stats array contained in the StatsFileSystem object
      void printStatsArray()
      print the array to stdout, for testing purpose only
      boolean readStatsFromFile()
      This method is used to read the stats data from file.
      java.lang.String searchForVersus(java.lang.String user1, java.lang.String user2)
      This method looks for the number of times that user1 won against user2.
      void setMaxNumOfUsers(int newMaxNumOfUsers)
      This method sets a new maximum number of users.
      void updateRecords(java.lang.String user1, int user1Wins, java.lang.String user2, int user2Wins)
      This method updates the versus records of two users user1 and user2 in the stats array.
      boolean writeStatsToFile()
      Write the information currently contained in the stats array to the file on hard drive.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static StatsFileSystem getInstance()
        The getter for singleton design, it makes sure that there is only one instance of this object.
        Returns:
        return the only instance of the StatsFileSystem object

      • getStatsArray

        public java.lang.String[][] getStatsArray()
        Return the stats array contained in the StatsFileSystem object
        Returns:
        return the stats array, which contains the versus records of all players

      • setMaxNumOfUsers

        public void setMaxNumOfUsers(int newMaxNumOfUsers)
        This method sets a new maximum number of users.

        It means that the stats array will have this number as the new size. This method is currently not used, it is here to allow the future developers to increase the amount of users this program can hold. The default maximum number of users is currently 100.

        Parameters:
        newMaxNumOfUsers - Takes in an int to set the new maximum of users.

      • printStatsArray

        public void printStatsArray()
        print the array to stdout, for testing purpose only

      • readStatsFromFile

        public boolean readStatsFromFile()
        This method is used to read the stats data from file.
        Returns:
        return true if success, false if fail.

      • writeStatsToFile

        public boolean writeStatsToFile()
        Write the information currently contained in the stats array to the file on hard drive.
        Returns:
        return true if success, false if fail.

      • searchForVersus

        public java.lang.String searchForVersus(java.lang.String user1,
                               java.lang.String user2)
        This method looks for the number of times that user1 won against user2.
        Parameters:
        user1 - A string which contains the username of user1.
        user2 - A string which contains the username of user2.
        Returns:
        return the number of wins as a string

      • updateRecords

        public void updateRecords(java.lang.String user1,
                 int user1Wins,
                 java.lang.String user2,
                 int user2Wins)
        This method updates the versus records of two users user1 and user2 in the stats array.
        Parameters:
        user1 - a String that is the username of user1.
        user1Wins - the number of times that user1 won against user2.
        user2 - a String that is the username of user2.
        user2Wins - the number of times that user2 won against user1.

      • addNewUserToArray

        public void addNewUserToArray(java.lang.String username)
        Add a new user to the stats array, with the corresponding 0s since this player has not played any game yet.
        Parameters:
        username - this method takes in a string that is the username of the new user.
